meanings.definition: An object made to resemble a human figure, used to scare birds away from crops.
meanings.sent1: The scarecrow stood tall in the field, guarding the corn.
meanings.sent2: Farmers often use a scarecrow to protect their vegetables from hungry birds.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous crows laughed at the scarecrow's attempt to shoo them away.
meanings.sent4: The scarecrow's outstretched arms seemed to wave at the passing wind.
meanings.sent5: The scarecrow's painted face glared menacingly at any bird that dared to come close.

meanings.definition: To frighten or intimidate someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise outside can scarecrow the little kitten.
meanings.sent2: She tried to scarecrow away the bullies by standing up tall and shouting.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected prank managed to scarecrow the entire group of friends.
meanings.sent4: His deep voice had the power to scarecrow even the bravest of souls.
meanings.sent5: The sudden thunderstorm seemed to scarecrow the birds into silence.
